AC.MX.summary: Arca Continental, S.A.B. de C.V., together with its subsidiaries, produces, distributes, and sells non-alcoholic beverages in Mexico, Peru, the United States, Argentina, and Ecuador. It operates through Beverages and Other segments. The company's products include cola, flavor soft, fruit/soy, and energy/sports drinks; water; tea; sugar/candies; coffee; ice cream snow/cones; yogurt/cream cheese; potato, plantain, and tortilla chips; corn puffs, popcorn, pork rinds, peanuts/seeds, sauces/dips, and baked goods; other carbonated and non-carbonated, and dairy beverages. It sells its products under the Coca-Cola Company, Aybal, DASANI, Ciel, Cepita Del Valle, Del Valle, Aquarius, Minute Maid, POWERADE, Fuze Tea, Ingenio FamaillÃ¡, Dulna, El Manjar Toni, Golos, Lato, BLaK, DUNKINÂ´DONUTS, Toni, Santa Clara, fairlife, Topsy, Tortolines, Prispas, Enre2, Tostitos, Bony, La Abeja, Bokados, Inalecsa, and Wise and Deep River brand names. It sells its non-alcoholic beverages under the Coca-Cola Company brand; and snacks under the brands. The company was formerly known as Embotelladoras Arca, S. A. B. de C. V. Arca Continental, S.A.B. de C.V. is based in Monterrey, Mexico.

CFS5.F.summary: Coca-Cola FEMSA, S.A.B. de C.V., a franchise bottler, produces, markets, sells, and distributes Coca-Cola trademark beverages. The company offers sparkling beverages, including colas and flavored sparkling beverages; and waters and still beverages, such as juice drinks, coffee, teas, milk, value-added dairy products, sports and energy drinks, and plant-based drinks. It provides a portfolio of products through retail outlets, such as wholesale supermarkets, discount stores, and convenience stores; retailers, such as restaurants and bars, as well as stadiums, auditoriums, and theaters; points-of-sale outlets; and home delivery, supermarkets, and other locations. The company also distributes and sells Heineken beer products in its Brazilian territories. It operates in Mexico, Guatemala, Nicaragua, Costa Rica, Panama, Colombia, Brazil, Argentina, and Uruguay. The company was founded in 1979 and is headquartered in Mexico City, Mexico. Coca-Cola FEMSA, S.A.B. de C.V. is a subsidiary of Fomento Economico Mexicano, S.A.B. de C.V.

CULTIBAB.MX.summary: OrganizaciÃ³n Cultiba, S.A.B. de C.V. produces, sells, and distributes carbonated and non-carbonated drinks in Mexico and internationally. It offers a portfolio of beverages, such as soft drinks, juices, iced tea, bottled water, and others. The company provides products under its own brands, as well as third-party brands. It also produces sugar; and generates electrical power through sugar cane mash. The company was formerly known as Grupo Embotelladoras Unidas S.A.B. de CV and changed its name to OrganizaciÃ³n Cultiba, S.A.B. de C.V. in December 2012. OrganizaciÃ³n Cultiba, S.A.B. de C.V. was founded in 1978 and is based in Mexico City, Mexico.
